comparison.description: How to compare the stored result of the specified command to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: How to compare the stored result of the specified command to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the stored result of the specified command to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value to compare the stored result of the specified command to.

type.description:
## Command --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/command) Compares the result of the specified command to the specified value. Type ID: `origins:command` --- ### ⚠️ Caution This entity condition type only operates on the server-side, meaning that it cannot be used in fields that are evaluated on the client-side. --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute if score @s objective1 = @s objective2", "comparison": "==", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if the entity has the same score in the `objective1` and `objective2` scoreboard objectives.
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute if entity @e[type = #minecraft:skeletons, distance = ..64]", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": 4 } ``` This example will check if there are 4 or more entities that are included in the `#minecraft:skeletons` (`data/minecraft/tags/entity_types/skeletons.json`) entity type tag within a 64 blocks spherical radius relative to the entity.
type.markdownDescription:
undefined## Command --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/command) Compares the result of the specified command to the specified value. Type ID: `origins:command` --- ### ⚠️ Caution This entity condition type only operates on the server-side, meaning that it cannot be used in fields that are evaluated on the client-side. --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute if score @s objective1 = @s objective2", "comparison": "==", "compare_to": 1 } ``` This example will check if the entity has the same score in the `objective1` and `objective2` scoreboard objectives.
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:command", "command": "execute if entity @e[type = #minecraft:skeletons, distance = ..64]", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": 4 } ``` This example will check if there are 4 or more entities that are included in the `#minecraft:skeletons` (`data/minecraft/tags/entity_types/skeletons.json`) entity type tag within a 64 blocks spherical radius relative to the entity.
